When he had closed his remarks, I felt urged by the Spirit of the Lord to bear my testimony. As I was led to speak upon the coming of Christ and the resurrection, and the cheering hope of the Christian, my soul triumphed in God; I drank in rich draughts of salvation. Heaven, sweet heaven, was the magnet 
                                                                           162
to draw my soul upward, and I was wrapped in a vision of God's glory. Many important matters were there revealed to me for the church.
